title: Clean energy is poised for growth in the new industrial age - Inhabitat
summary: The article discusses the substantial growth of clean energy manufacturing leading to a new industrial age, with projections of a significant increase in investment in sustainable technologies, clean energy, and clean energy manufacturing across the globe.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the growth of clean energy manufacturing and investment in sustainable technologies, which align with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus of the article is on clean energy manufacturing and investment, rather than on new or improved products or business processes within a firm.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions the manufacturing of wind turbines, heat pumps, batteries for electric vehicles, solar panels, and electrolyzers for hydrogen power, all of which contribute to reducing environmental impact and promoting sustainability.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights methods and technologies in manufacturing clean energy products that aim to reduce waste, conserve natural resources, and limit harmful emissions, thus promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 211111 - Crude Petroleum and Natural Gas Extraction, 221114 - Solar Power Generation, 335312 - Motor and Generator Manufacturing, 541710 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences
greenwashing: FALSE. The article provides information on the growth and investments in clean energy manufacturing and technologies without attempting to deceive or mislead regarding environmental benefits.

title: Top U.S. clean energy trends to watch in 2023 - Inhabitat
summary: The article discusses clean energy trends impacting the shift towards a sustainable future including the rise of electric vehicles, offshore wind farms, and climate-targeted legislation.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses clean energy trends and climate-targeted legislation, which are green innovations focused on environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on clean energy trends and climate legislation rather than new or improved products or business processes.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not specifically highlight the design, manufacturing, or use of a specific product in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article mentions environmentally friendly practices such as offshore wind energy and climate legislation that promote sustainability and minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 221119 - Other Electric Power Generation, 237130 - Power and Communication Line and Related Structures Construction, 562910 - Remediation Services, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not contain any indications of greenwashing as it primarily focuses on clean energy trends and climate legislation without providing false or misleading environmental claims.
